fields.value: Replication Data for: Modeling Related Processes with an Excess of Zeros

dsDescriptionValue.value:
Political science research frequently models binary or ordered outcomes involving related processes. However, traditional modeling of these outcomes ignores
common data issues and cannot capture nuances. There is often an excess of
zeros, the observed outcomes for different actors are inherently related, and competing actors may respond to the same factors differently. This paper extends
existing models and develops a zero-inflated multivariate ordered probit to simultaneously address these issues. This model performs better than existing models
at capturing the true parameters of interest, estimates the nature of the related
processes, and captures the differences in actorsâ€™ decision-making. I demonstrate
these benefits through simulation exercises and an application to party behavior
in Mexico.

producerName.value: Enter your name here: LastName, FirstName

files.description: This is a compressed file with all of the replication code and data. Each subfolder has a README file that explains the folder's contents. Much of the code has a very long run-time, so all model fits are also included as .Rdata files, so the replication code can be run without fitting the models.
files.label: ZIMVOPReplication.tar.gz

dataFile.description: This is a compressed file with all of the replication code and data. Each subfolder has a README file that explains the folder's contents. Much of the code has a very long run-time, so all model fits are also included as .Rdata files, so the replication code can be run without fitting the models.
